ds_grid_value_disk_exists: With this function you can check to see if a specific value (real or string) is present within a circular area of a given DS grid. If it is present the function will return <tt>true</tt> otherwise it will return <tt>false</tt>.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.

{ANY_CODE} if ds_grid_value_disk_exists(grid, 5, 5, 5, val)
{nbsp_x3}{
{nbsp_x3}xpos = ds_grid_value_disk_x(grid, 5, 5, 5, val);
{nbsp_x3}ypos = ds_grid_value_disk_y(grid, 5, 5, 5, val);
{nbsp_x3}}
The above code checks a DS grid for a specific value within a disk region. if it is found, it then stores the x and y position of the value in two variables for later use.
